parameters.name: statsPriority
parameters.description: When to sync table statistics for every table in the schema. Valid options are the following. Option: 'flag' means to flag stats for the next scheduled run of a full table scan on the database. Option: 'block' means to block this job on stats syncing. Option: 'queue' means to queue a separate job for syncing stats and do not block this job on the queued job. Defaults to 'flag'

parameters.description: The name of the model.

parameters.description: A description of the model.

parameters.name: interactionTerms
parameters.description: Whether to search for interaction terms.

parameters.name: boxCoxTransformation
parameters.description: Whether to transform data so that it assumes a normal distribution. Valid only with continuous models.

parameters.name: modelTypeId
parameters.description: The ID of the model's type.

parameters.name: primaryKey
parameters.description: The unique ID (primary key) of the training dataset.

parameters.name: dependentVariable
parameters.description: The dependent variable of the training dataset.

parameters.name: dependentVariableOrder
parameters.description: The order of dependent variables, especially useful for Ordinal Modeling.

parameters.name: excludedColumns
parameters.description: A list of columns which will be considered ineligible to be independent variables.

parameters.name: limitingSQL
parameters.description: A custom SQL WHERE clause used to filter the rows used to build the model. (e.g., "id > 105").

parameters.name: activeBuildId
parameters.description: The ID of the current active build, the build used to score predictions.

parameters.name: crossValidationParameters

parameters.description: The schedule when the model will be built.

parameters.description: The ID of the parent job that will trigger this model.

parameters.description: The time zone of this model.

parameters.name: training_table_name
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the models returned by the training dataset table name. Substring matching is supported. (e.g., "trainingTableName=table" will return both "table1" and "my_table").

parameters.name: dependent_variable
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the models returned by the dependent variable column name. Substring matching is supported. (e.g., "dependentVariable=predictor" will return both "predictor" and "my predictor").

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: If specified, return models from this author. It accepts a comma-separated list of author ids.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: If specified, returns models with one of these statuses. It accepts a comma-separated list, possible values are 'running', 'failed', 'succeeded', 'idle', 'scheduled'.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to its maximum of 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at, name, created_at, last_run.updated_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the model.

x-examples.description: Update the dependent variable and excluded columns

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the model.

parameters.name: tableName
parameters.description: The qualified name of the table containing the training set from which to build the model.

parameters.name: databaseId
parameters.description: The ID of the database holding the training set table used to build the model.

parameters.name: credentialId
parameters.description: The ID of the credential used to read the target table. Defaults to the user's default credential.

parameters.name: modelName
parameters.description: The name of the model.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A description of the model.

parameters.name: interactionTerms
parameters.description: Whether to search for interaction terms.

parameters.name: boxCoxTransformation
parameters.description: Whether to transform data so that it assumes a normal distribution. Valid only with continuous models.

parameters.name: modelTypeId
parameters.description: The ID of the model's type.

parameters.name: primaryKey
parameters.description: The unique ID (primary key) of the training dataset.

parameters.name: dependentVariable
parameters.description: The dependent variable of the training dataset.

parameters.name: dependentVariableOrder
parameters.description: The order of dependent variables, especially useful for Ordinal Modeling.

parameters.name: excludedColumns
parameters.description: A list of columns which will be considered ineligible to be independent variables.

parameters.name: limitingSQL
parameters.description: A custom SQL WHERE clause used to filter the rows used to build the model. (e.g., "id > 105").

parameters.name: activeBuildId
parameters.description: The ID of the current active build, the build used to score predictions.

parameters.name: crossValidationParameters
parameters.description: Cross validation parameter grid for tree methods, e.g. {"n_estimators": [100, 200, 500], "learning_rate": [0.01, 0.1], "max_depth": [2, 3]}.

parameters.name: numberOfFolds
parameters.description: Number of folds for cross validation. Default value is 5.

parameters.name: notifications
parameters.description: The notifications to send after the script is run.

parameters.name: schedule
parameters.description: The schedule when the model will be built.

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: The ID of the parent job that will trigger this model.

parameters.name: timeZone
parameters.description: The time zone of this model.

get.summary: List Custom Scripts

parameters.name: from_template_id
parameters.description: If specified, return scripts based on the template with this ID. Specify multiple IDs as a comma-separated list.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: If specified, return items from this author. Must use user IDs. A comma separated list of IDs is also accepted to return items from multiple authors.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: If specified, returns items with one of these statuses. It accepts a comma-separated list, possible values are 'running', 'failed', 'succeeded', 'idle', 'scheduled'.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to its maximum of 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at, name, created_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to asc.

post.summary: Creates and enqueues a single table scanner job on a new table

parameters.name: databaseId
parameters.description: The ID of the database.

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: The name of the schema containing the table.

parameters.name: tableName
parameters.description: The name of the table.

parameters.name: statsPriority
parameters.description: When to sync table statistics. Valid Options are the following. Option: 'flag' means to flag stats for the next scheduled run of a full table scan on the database. Option: 'block' means to block this job on stats syncing. Option: 'queue' means to queue a separate job for syncing stats and do not block this job on the queued job. Defaults to 'flag'

get.summary: List tables

parameters.name: database_id
parameters.description: The ID of the database.

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the tables returned. Substring matching is supported with "%" and "*" wildcards (e.g., "schema=%census%" will return both "client_census.table" and "census_2010.table").

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the tables returned. Substring matching is supported with "%" and "*" wildcards (e.g., "name=%table%" will return both "table1" and "my table").

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the tables returned. Will search across schema and name (in the full form schema.name) and will return any full name containing the search string.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 50. Maximum allowed is 1000.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to schema. Must be one of: schema, name, search.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to asc.

x-examples.description: create a workflow from a definition

requests.request_body:
{
  "name": "wf",
  "definition": "---
version: 2

my_workflow:
  type: direct
  tasks:
    task_1: &run
      action: civis.run_job
    task_2:
      <<: *run
",
  "description": "This workflow takes Obama campaign data and does things"
}

scheduledDays.description: Day based on numeric value starting at 0 for Sunday.

scheduledHours.description: Hours of the day it is scheduled on.

scheduledMinutes.description: Minutes of the day it is scheduled on.

scheduledRunsPerHour.description: Alternative to scheduled minutes, number of times to run per hour.

urls.description: URLs to receive a POST request at job completion

successEmailSubject.description: Custom subject line for success e-mail.

successEmailBody.description: Custom body text for success e-mail, written in Markdown.

successEmailAddresses.description: Addresses to notify by e-mail when the job completes successfully.

successEmailFromName.description: Name from which success emails are sent; defaults to "Civis."

successEmailReplyTo.description: Address for replies to success emails; defaults to the author of the job.

failureEmailAddresses.description: Addresses to notify by e-mail when the job fails.

stallWarningMinutes.description: Stall warning emails will be sent after this amount of minutes.

successOn.description: If success email notifications are on.

failureOn.description: If failure email notifications are on.

diststyle.description: The diststyle to use for the table. One of "even", "all", or "key".

sortkeys.description: Sortkeys for this table in Redshift. Please provide a maximum of two.

source.description: The source file(s). Provide either an array of Civis file_ids or a storage path hash with an array of one or more file_paths.

firstRowIsHeader.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not the first row of the source file is a header row.

columnDelimiter.description: The column delimiter for the file. Valid arguments are "comma", "tab", and "pipe". Defaults to "comma".

escaped.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not the source file has quotes escaped with a backslash.Defaults to false.

compression.description: The type of compression of the source file. Valid arguments are "gzip" and "none". Defaults to "none".

existingTableRows.description: The behavior if a destination table with the requested name already exists.  One of "fail", "truncate", "append", "drop", or "upsert".Defaults to "fail".

maxErrors.description: The maximum number of rows with errors to ignore before failing. This option is not supported for Postgres databases.

tableColumns.description: An array of hashes corresponding to the columns in the source file. Each hash should have keys for column "name" and "type"

loosenTypes.description: If true, SQL types with precisions/lengths will have these values increased to accomodate data growth in future loads. Type loosening only occurs on table creation. Defaults to false.

execution.description: In upsert mode, controls the movement of data in upsert mode. If set to "delayed", the data will be moved after a brief delay. If set to "immediate", the data will be moved immediately. In non-upsert modes, controls the speed at which detailed column stats appear in the data catalogue. Defaults to "delayed", to accomodate concurrent upserts to the same table and speedier non-upsert imports.

cpu.description: The number of CPU shares to allocate for the container. Each core has 1000 shares. Must be at least 2 shares.

memory.description: The amount of RAM to allocate for the container (in MB). Must be at least 4 MB.

diskSpace.description: The amount of disk space, in GB, to allocate for the container. This space will be used to hold the git repo configured for the container and anything your container writes to /tmp or /data. Fractional values (e.g. 0.25) are supported.
